title: Understanding Occupational Therapy
text: Occupational therapists help students engage in school activities by addressing various challenges they might face.

title: Focus Areas of Occupational Therapy
text: Consider how occupational therapists assist students with sensory issues and social participation.

hintAnswer: supporting a student's participation in $$school-related$$ routines and activities, including issues like coping with sensory issues, participating social activities
title: Identifying the Role of Occupational Therapists
text: Which of the following best describes the role of occupational therapists in schools?
choices: process of systemically applying interventions to modify an individual's behavior and at the same time collecting data to evaluate the effect of each intervention on the individual's behavior
working with young children and students with ASD on a variety of activities, spending more time with the student and can provide valuable insight into the student's strengths and areas of needs
supporting a student's participation in $$school-related$$ routines and activities, including issues like coping with sensory issues, participating social activities
helping students who have trouble with communication skills perform important learning and $$school-related$$ activities, like working on social communication
